intro: Brachystephanus africanus, commonly known as the African stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant.
